title: Trump says he will increase his new global tariffs to 15%
byline: US President Donald Trump has said that he will impose global tariffs of 15%, as he continued to rail against a Supreme Court ruling that struck down his previous import taxes.

title: Two injured as lorry overturns in Watawala
byline: Two persons were injured when a lorry travelling along the Hatton–Colombo road veered off the roadway and overturned in the Watawala area during the early hours yesterday (21).

title: Avoid parking vehicles near landslide-prone areas: DMC
byline: Residents in the western slopes of the Central Hills have been urged to avoid parking vehicles near landslide-prone areas as heavy rains continue to lash the region, increasing the risk of earth slips.

title: Somawathiya road closed as Mahaweli river overflows at Manampitiya
byline: The Somawathiya Road in the Lankapura Divisional Secretariat Division has been closed to traffic after the Mahaweli River overflowed at Manampitiya due to torrential rains in the upper catchment areas.

title: Peradeniya recorded the highest rainfall in the country
byline: Peradeniya recorded the highest rainfall in the country during the 21-hour period ending at 6.00 a.m. today, with a significant 213.2 mm of rain reported in the Mahaweli Basin, according to the latest hydrological data.

title: Islandwide river levels normal; minor flood reported at Manampitiya
byline: Water levels in most major rivers across the country remained within normal limits as of 6.30 a.m. today (22), according to the latest Islandwide Water Level and Rainfall Situation Report.

title: Red alert declared: Evacuation orders issued for four districts
byline: The Disaster Management Center (DMC) has initiated the evacuation of residents to safe centers following a red notice issued by the National Building Research Organization (NBRO) today (21).

title: Suspect arrested over Akuregoda shooting
byline: Police have arrested one of the two suspects allegedly involved in the fatal shooting of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda.

title: Explainer: Where are the world’s most endangered languages?
byline: On International Mother Language Day, we explore which languages are most at risk of disappearing, where they are spoken, and why preserving them matters for all of us.

title: Namal welcomes Fonseka’s statement on Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer and Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa said that it is a positive development that Sarath Fonseka has publicly said that former President Mahinda Rajapaksa is not a murderer.

title: CEB seeks 13.56% tariff hike, PUCSL opens public consultation
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has proposed a 13.56% increase in electricity tariffs for the second quarter of 2026, prompting the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) to open public consultations from February 25 to March 18.

title: Sri Lanka reports record tourism and remittance earnings in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka recorded significant economic achievements in 2025, with tourism arrivals reaching 2.36 million, generating USD 3.2 billion, while migrant worker remittances exceeded USD 7.8 billion, highlighting the country’s expanding global economic presence, Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment & Tourism Minister Vijitha Herath said.

title: Heavy rainfall warning issued for several provinces
byline: Residents in the Central, Uva and Sabaragamuwa provinces, as well as the Ampara, Batticaloa and Polonnaruwa districts, have been urged to remain vigilant due to a low-level atmospheric disturbance in the vicinity of Sri Lanka.

title: Life-saving drugs scarce in hospitals
byline: Despite assurances from the Health Ministry that medicines are available, medical associations say shortages of essential drugs continue to plague government hospitals.

title: Environmentalists call for halt to Jaffna Cricket Stadium project
byline: The Wildlife and Nature Protection Society (WNPS) has urged authorities to immediately suspend construction of the proposed Jaffna International Cricket Stadium and Sports Complex on Mandaitivu Island alleging that the project is proceeding without mandatory environmental clearances.

title: Govt-LTTE ideologies alike, says Namal after Cambridge union cancellation
byline: The ideology of the Government and that of the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam (LTTE) now appear similar, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna National Organiser and MP Namal Rajapaksa alleged, following the cancellation of his scheduled lecture at the Cambridge Union in the United Kingdom.

title: Patients caught in crossfire as GMOA strike enters 12th day
byline: The ongoing trade union action launched by the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) entered its 12th day today, with the union claiming that the Health Ministry has still failed to provide concrete solutions to the issues raised.

title: One injured in shooting in Gandara
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in the Gandara area of Matara.

title: Kandalama Tank overflow disrupts Dambulla-Wewala traffic
byline: The overflow of Kandalama tanks yesterday obstructed traffic on the Dambulla-Wewala main road, causing inconvenience to tourists and disrupting civilian life.

title: Two convicted of murder sentenced to death by Balapitiya HC
byline: Two accused who stood indicted with murder were found guilty and sentenced to death by Balapitiya High Court Judge Priyantha Liyanage.Wijeyamuni Darshana Dinesh de Silva (37) and Laththuwahandi Ranga Pradeep de Silva (41) had, on September 04, 2005, hacked to death a resident of the area Porawagamage Manoj Champika Kumara at Maduwa in Balapitiya.

title: ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026: Super 8's Group Tables & Points Standings
byline: View the latest ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026 group tables and points standings. See how teams are ranked, how qualification works, and what each position means.

title: Health issues prevent Maithree Wickremesinghe from appearing before CID
byline: Professor Maithree Wickremesinghe has informed the Financial Crimes Investigation Division of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) that she is unable to appear before them yesterday to record a statement regarding the alleged misappropriation of state funds during a private visit to London by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, Police Spokesman ASP F.U Wootler said.

title: Nasa targets early March to send humans back around the Moon
byline: Nasa is targeting early March to launch a crew around the Moon for the first time in more than 50 years, in what would be humankind’s furthest trip into space.

title: Divisional Secretaries up in arms against political interference in land administration
byline: The Association of Divisional Secretaries and Assistant Divisional Secretaries has alleged that the private secretary to Deputy Minister Aravinda Senarath had been severely interfering with their work, particularly in the discharge of duties related to land matters.

title: Ven Kotapitiye Rahula Thera urges President and PM to retract controversial remarks
byline: Venerable Professor Kotapitiye Rahula Thera, Anunayake of the Sri Kalyani Samagri Dharma Maha Sangha Sabha, has called on the President and Prime Minister to withdraw their recent remarks made in Jaffna and Mannar, emphasizing that they should publicly apologize.

title: Man arrested in Mount Lavinia with ice drugs worth over Rs. 800,000
byline: A 33-year-old man from Ratmalana was arrested in the Soysapura area of Mount Lavinia while transporting ice drugs valued at over Rs. 800,000. Police recovered 50 grams of the substance and Rs. 44,000 in cash, suspected to be proceeds from drug trafficking.

title: Jealous husband jailed for life after killing wife in a car park
byline: A 37-year-old man has been given a life sentence after he stabbed his estranged wife to death in a car park after she began a relationship with a work colleague.

title: Landslide alert issued for central and Uva provinces
byline: The National Building Research Institute (NBRO) has called for heightened vigilance across several Divisional Secretariat areas in the central and Uva provinces, citing ongoing risks of landslides due to prevailing conditions.

title: Moratorium on foreign research totally an unwise decision, meant to serve political agendas: Expert
byline: The government’s moratorium on foreign research vessels is totally an unwise decision and meant to serve the political agendas only, an expert said.

title: Trump brings in new 10% tariff as Supreme Court rejects his global import taxes
byline: US President Donald Trump has imposed a new 10% global tariff to replace ones struck down by the Supreme Court, calling the ruling ’’terrible’’ and lambasting the justices who rejected his trade policy as ’’fools’’.

title: Foreign tourists enjoy scenic train ride from Ambewela to Ella
byline: A large group of foreign tourists boarded the train from Ambewela to Badulla today (22), heading towards the picturesque Ella Railway Station, Station Master Asendra Dissanayake confirmed.

title: Namal visits London Buddhist Vihara amid UK protests
byline: SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa began his United Kingdom visit by paying homage at the London Buddhist Vihara, which is celebrating its 100th anniversary this year. During the visit, he received blessings from members of the Maha Sangha, his office said.

title: Three injured as train collides with cab in Payagala
byline: Three people were injured when a Coastal Line train collided with a cab at a railway crossing in Payagala earlier today, the Railways Department said.

title: Pakistan launches strikes on Afghanistan, with Taliban saying dozens killed
byline: Pakistan has carried out multiple overnight air strikes on Afghanistan, which the Taliban has said killed and wounded dozens of people, including women and children.

title: CTU demands immediate circular to halt school fund collections
byline: The Ceylon Teachers’ Union (CTU) has alleged that schools continue to collect money from parents despite the Education Ministry’s recent statement that fund collection is not permitted, calling the situation “deeply distressing” for families.

title: Lanka doctors in US donate machines to advance mental health treatment
byline: The Sri Lankan Medical Association of North America (SLMANA) has donated two Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) machines to Sri Lanka, with one machine going to the National Hospital of Sri Lanka in Colombo and the other to Jaffna Hospital in Jaffna, marking a significant advancement in mental health treatment options available across the country.

title: Change of Guard as Sanjaya Fernando elected new Referee Boss
byline: Former Isipathana College and Sri Lanka Air Force Sports Club rugby player Sanjaya Fernando was elected as the President of the Sri Lanka Society of Rugby Football Referees (SLSRFR) in their Annual General Meeting (AGM), which concluded in Maharagama today.

title: England bowl out Sri Lanka for 95 to open Super 8 campaign in style
byline: England kick-started their T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 campaign with a statement 51-run victory over hosts Sri Lanka at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium on Sunday. Despite being restricted to a modest total of 146/9, England’s bowling attack, led by a clinical spell from Will Jacks, proved too much for the Sri Lankan batters, who collapsed for just 95 runs in 16.4 overs.

title: Murali's coach Sunil no more
byline: Former Antonian legendary coach Sunil Fernando passed away in Kandy recently after a brief illness. He coached some topclass former cricketers such as Muttiah Muralitharan and Kumar Sangakkara.
